email.subject: Call for Participation: 41st IEEE International Conference on Software Maintenance and Evolution (ICSME 2025)

conference.name: IEEE International Conference on Software Maintenance and Evolution
program_highlights: Cutting-edge research on software evolution, maintenance, and analysis
Invited keynotes by international thought leaders
Co-located conferences: SCAM and VISSOFT are taking place earlier in the week.
Panels, tool demos, and community activities
Networking opportunities with researchers, practitioners, and students from around the globe
Conference reception and cultural activities in vibrant Auckland

student_volunteers.description: Get involved, meet mentors, and experience the conference from the inside.

travel_support.description: Travel support for US-based attendees is available through generous NSF funding.

logistics_and_sustainability.description: ICSME 2025 aims to be environmentally conscious and socially inclusive.
logistics_and_sustainability.discount_codes: Discount codes for nearby hotels and international travel will be provided upon registration.
logistics_and_sustainability.accessibility_inclusivity: Making arrangements to ensure accessibility and inclusivity for all attendees, including those from LGBTQ+, disabled, and neurodiverse communities.

explore_research.description: If you are attending ICSME in Auckland and plan to travel the country, you can contact some of NZ's software engineering researchers for a chat, a seminar, or simply to (re)connect.

conference.closing_remarks: We look forward to seeing you this September in Auckland for a week of inspiration, connection, and impactful research in software evolution.

contribution.method: To contribute to SEWORLD, send your submission to
